details.title: Jharkhand reports 9 more deaths
details.content: This is Jharkhand's highest single-day fatality, as the toll climbed to 76, said a government bulletin issued on Friday. The state also reported 314 fresh COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases to 7,564.

details.title: 1,025 fresh cases take Delhi tally to 1,28,389
details.content: Delhi recorded 1,025 fresh coronavirus cases on Friday, taking the tally in the city to over 1.28 lakh, while the death toll from the disease rose to 3,777, authorities said. From July 11-19, fresh cases were being reported in the range of 1,000-2,000 consecutively. The number of fresh cases reported on July 19 stood at 1,211.

details.title: Five additional testing labs being set up in J&K
details.content: Jammu & Kashmir Medical Supplies Corporation Limited (JKMSCL) -- a fully-owned company of the J-K government -- has placed purchase orders for machinery and equipment for these laboratories, he said. The official said these labs are likely to be made functional in the next two weeks.

details.title: Chhattisgarh reports record spike of 426 cases
details.content: The state saw its biggest single-day spike of 426 new COVID-19 cases, 14 of them BSF personnel, which took the case tally in the state to 6,819, a health department official said. The death count mounted to 36 after two more people succumbed to the viral infection and co-morbidities, he said.

details.title: Thane count crosses 75k mark
details.content: An addition of 1,698 cases on Friday took Thane district's COVID-19 count to 75,664 while the death toll increased by 22 to touch 2,075, said an official. Kalyan accounted for 342 of the new cases, taking the count there to 17,731, while Thane city's count rose by 285 to reach 17,144, and Navi Mumbai added 308 cases during the day and its caseload is now 12,907, he added.

details.title: 100-year-old recovers in Karnataka
details.content:
Karnataka: Hallamma, a 100-year-old woman from Huvina Hadagali town of Bellary district who had tested positive for #COVID19, claims that she has now recovered from the disease. She says, "Doctors treated me well. I am healthy now." Her son had also tested positive for COVID. pic.twitter.com/3RxJbaPkGQ

— ANI (@ANI) July 24, 2020

— ANI (@ANI) July 24, 2020

It consists of unfurling of the National Flag by Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami, playing of the National Anthem, presentation of Guard of Honour by the police including paramilitary forces, home guards, NCC, Scouts, etc, speech by the Chief Minister and singing of the National Anthem.

details.content:
For the project, ICMR scientists will collaborate with researchers at the AIIMS-Delhi where a cohort of recovered Covid-19 patients will be studied over a period of time to assess their antibody levels and its role in coming months.

details.title: India records 757 deaths, 48,916 new coronavirus cases in last 24-hours
details.content: According to the data published on Health Ministry's wesbite, total 48,916 new cases were recorded in last 24-hours. Meanwhile, the death toll reached 31,358 after 757 new fatalities. Total coronavirus positive cases in India now stands at 13,36,861 including 4,56,071 active cases, 8,49,431 cured/discharged/migrated and 31,358 deaths.(File Photo | EPS)

details.title: Odisha: First patient to receive plasma therapy defeats virus
details.content:
At the time of admission, she had symptoms of acute respiratory distress and required oxygen. She was kept in the ICU with administration of oxygen and all supportive medication. As her oxygen requirement continued to remain high and chest X-ray showed signs of pneumonia, doctors decided to give her convalescent plasma therapy.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | Beijing partly reopens movie theatres as virus threat declines
details.content:
Cinemas in parts of the city deemed at low risk of cross-infection began admitting moviegoers under social distancing rules. Tickets must be booked in advance, attendance is capped at 30% of capacity and no eating or drinking is allowed during the show. As with most venues in China, a temperature check and online travel record were required for entry.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.content:
'The district, which has 7,000 beds in 30 COVID-19 hospitals, has 1,400 doctors, including 400 private ones. Besides, there are only 400 nurses, including 200 in private hospitals. The administration is now hard-pressed to overcome the shortage of manpower, particularly in government hospitals,' said Andhra Medical College principal and north Andhra Covid special officer PV Sudhakar.

details.content:
80-year-old Varavara Rao was undergoing treatment in Mumbai hospitals since July 16 after being tested positive for COVID-19. He is behind bars for almost 22 months in connection with the Elgar Parishad case and had approached the special NIA court, seeking bail on medical grounds under the prevailing pandemic situation.

details.content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said people of the city, his government and the Centre together have attained victory over COVID-19 but the fight is not yet over. Speaking at the inauguration of a 450-bed Delhi government hospital in Burari via videoconferencing, he said in the last one month, coronavirus-related parameters have improved in the national capital. details.title: More than 4,20,000 COVID-19 tests conducted in a single day: Government of India
details.content: For the first time, a record number of more than 4,20,000 COVID-19 tests conducted in a single day. With 4,20,898 samples tested in last 24 hours, the Tests Per Million (TPM) has increased to 11,485 and cumulative testing to 1,58,49,068: Government of India

details.title: Comprehensive town-wide lockdown to be imposed in Kalimpong Municipality for seven days
details.content:
Comprehensive town-wide lockdown to be imposed in Kalimpong Municipality for seven days, starting 9 am on 26 July, to curb the spread of #COVID19.#WestBengal pic.twitter.com/TEm0ycntKd

— ANI (@ANI) July 25, 2020

details.title: Teaching and non-teaching staff in Goa allowed to work from home
details.content: Teaching and non-teaching staff of various schools and educational institutes in Goa have now been allowed to work from home, the state government has said. A circular issued by Goa education director Suresh Amonkar stated schools, education and coaching institutions in the state will remain closed until July 31.

details.title: Priyanka Gandhi slams UP government over COVID-19 handling in letter to CM Yogi Adityanath
details.content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Saturday attacked the Yogi Adityanath government over its handling of the COVID-19 crisis, saying that at a time when there is an "explosive" growth in cases, its "no test is equal to no corona" policy can lead to a "frightening situation". In a letter to the Uttar Pradesh chief minister, the Congress general secretary said that the battle against the pandemic cannot be fought by just "managing publicity and news". (READ MORE)

details.title: 557 fresh COVID-19 cases in Rajasthan, six more die
details.content: Rajasthan recorded 557 fresh COVID-19 cases on Saturday, taking the state's tally to 34,735, while six more fatalities pushed the toll to 608, according to an official report. Ajmer and Kota districts reported three deaths each, the report stated. Of the fresh cases, Alwar reported the maximum at 313.

details.title: Tejashwi Yadav accuses Nitish Kumar of being invisible for 130 days amid COVID-19 crisis
details.content: Stepping up his attack on Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, the leader of the opposition Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday pleaded, albeit sarcastically, with Nitish Kumar not to remain 'invisible' amid the COVID-19 pandemic and floods. (READ MORE)

details.title: Tripura's toll rises to 11, COVID-19 tally mounts to 3,778
details.content: One more person succumbed to COVID-19 in Tripura, taking the northeastern state's toll to 11, while 106 fresh infections pushed its case count to 3,778, a health official said on Saturday. The latest fatality was reported from Gomati district. A 70-year-old man from Gomati's Udaipur died due to COVID-19 on Friday, the official said.

details.title: Kerala News Updates
details.content:
- Two more COVID deaths reported in the state
- NIA to interrogate M Sivasankar on Monday
- CPM's Central Committee meeting starts today

Check out the major developments from Kerala@NewIndianXpress @MSKiranPrakash pic.twitter.com/dJkVBzJFG8

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) July 25, 2020

details.title: Over 18 lakh pleas filed in courts during lockdown: SC judge
details.content: Over 18 lakh pleas were filed across courts in India during the coronavirus-induced lockdown between March and July, Supreme Court judge Justice D Y Chandrachud said on Saturday. He also said that virtual courts, which have been set up under "very very exceptional circumstances", are not here stay and the physical courts would gradually start functioning once again.

details.title: Over 8,200 Maharashtra cops got infected, 93 succumbed to COVID-19
details.content: Over 8,200 police personnel have contracted coronavirus infection in Maharashtra so far, while 93, including seven officers, have succumbed to it, an official said on Saturday. As per official data, more than 8,200 personnel tested positive for coronavirus while implementing prohibitory orders, of which 6,314 recovered from the infection.

details.title: Superintendent of Police office in Baddi and police station in Barotiwala sealed: Himachal Pradesh District Authorities
details.content: Superintendent of Police office in Baddi and police station in Barotiwala sealed after an accused and a police personnel tested positive for COVID-19. Total of 21 personnel quarantined: Himachal Pradesh District Authorities

details.title: Police personnel check IDs of commuters in Guwahati
details.content:
Assam: Police personnel check IDs of commuters in Guwahati amid #COVID19 induced lockdown. pic.twitter.com/c2Eao3iFpw

— ANI (@ANI) July 25, 2020

details.title: Mylab to scale up production of COVID-19 testing kits with funding from DBT
details.content: Pune-based Mylab Discovery Solutions has scaled up its development and production of COVID-19 testing kit with the help of strategic funding by the Department of Biotechnology, an official statement said on Saturday. Currently, Mylab has a manufacturing capacity of 2,00,000 RT-PCR and 50,000 RNA tests.

details.title: Packing of relief packets for flood-affected people in Gopalganj
details.content:
Patna: Packing of relief packets for flood-affected people in Gopalganj facilitated by district authorities.

DM says, "10,000 packets will be air-dropped. Packets weigh 5kgs & contain flattened rice, jaggery, chana, candles & matchboxes. We seal them to avoid damage." #Bihar pic.twitter.com/dDU9GTg6fV

— ANI (@ANI) July 25, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 positive patient jumps to death from AIIMS building in Patna
details.content: In a tragic turn of events, a 22-year-old COVID-19 patient killed himself by jumping from the third floor of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) building in Patna on Friday evening.  According to police sources, the victim, identified as Rohit Kumar, resident of Mohammapur Bihta, had tested positive for the virus recently and was admitted in AIIMS on July 20. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 hospital overcharges patients in Maharashtra's Thane; loses licence
details.content: The civic body in Maharashtra's Thane city on Saturday suspended the licence of a private hospital and cancelled its classification as a COVID-19 facility after it allegedly overcharged patients. The Thane Municipal Corporation set up an audit team to examine bills and detected excess billing to the tune of Rs 27 lakh by 15 hospitals.

details.title: India's COVID-19 testing hits record high of 4.20 lakh samples a day
details.content: India has gradually ramped-up its testing capacity for COVID-19 and conducted over 4.20 lakh tests in a day, the highest ever, the Union Health Ministry said Saturday, crediting the increase in number of labs for the achievement. India had only one lab for testing samples for the disease in January but it has now increased the number to 1,301, including private labs.

details.title: Serum Institute of India seeks DCGI permission for phase 2/3 clinical trials of Oxford's COVID 'vaccine'
details.content: Serum Institute of India (SII), which has partnered with AstraZeneca for manufacturing the Oxford vaccine candidate for COVID-19, has sought permission from the Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) for conducting phase 2/3 human clinical trials of the potential vaccine, highly-placed sources said on Saturday.

details.title: Three booked for poor upkeep of hostel-turned COVID facility
details.content: The civic body in Maharashtra's Thane city on Saturday suspended the licence of a private hospital and cancelled its classification as a COVID-19 facility after it allegedly overcharged patients. The Thane Municipal Corporation set up an audit team to examine bills and detected excess billing to the tune of Rs 27 lakh by 15 hospitals. (READ MORE)

details.title: Import licenses for rapid diagnostic kits of three firms cancelled, 16 suspended by DCGI
details.content: India's drug regulator has cancelled the rapid diagnostic kit import licenses of three firms and suspended that of 16 others saying the USFDA has removed the manufacturers from their list of coronavirus serology test kits with directions that they should not be distributed.

details.title: Amid COVID-19 lockdown, students in Chennai receive their Class 12 marksheets
details.content:
Amid the #COVID__19 #lockdown, students in Chennai receive their Class 12 marksheets from Presidency Govt Girls High School at Egmore. @xpresstn @shibasahu2012

Express Photos | @ashwinacharya05 pic.twitter.com/8gec0rkwqX

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) July 25, 2020

details.title: BJP delegation will meet Rajasthan Governor Kalraj Mishra at Raj Bhawan later today, over COVID-19 situation in state
details.content: Rajasthan: BJP delegation led by State BJP President Satish Punia and Leader of Opposition Gulab Chandra Kataria will meet Governor Kalraj Mishra at Raj Bhawan later today, over COVID-19 situation in the state.

details.title: Karnataka News Updates
details.content:
Karnataka will be observing a complete lockdown on Sunday. JMFC Court summons CM @BSYBJP. DCM @drashwathcn interacts with M S Ramaiah hospital management@preejap13 and @vinodkumart5 gives more details
Editing @MeghanaSastry pic.twitter.com/W7I6fVGJQb

— TNIE Karnataka (@XpressBengaluru) July 25, 2020

details.title: Overemphasis on fever as Covid-19 symptom may have led to a large cases being missed: AIIMS study
details.content: A study of Covid-19 patients, admitted in two facilities under AIIMS-Delhi, has cautioned against overemphasis on fever as a predominant symptom of coronavirus saying that it may lead to several cases being missed. The study, based on the clinical profile of 144 patients admitted in AIIMS trauma centre and the institution's Jhajjar centre in March-April, was published in the Indian Council of Medical Research’s Indian Journal of Medical Research. (READ MORE)

details.title: Judges panel rules out possibility of physical hearing in SC for 'time being'
details.content: A committee of seven Supreme Court judges has apprised the bar leaders of its decision to not open the apex court for physical hearings "for the time being" and would meet them again after two weeks to reconsider the issue. The apex court, since March 25, has been holding courts through video conferencing due to a nationwide lockdown and even after the restrictions were relaxed, it has decided to continue with the hearing through virtual courts. (READ MORE)

details.title: 2,803 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Bihar
details.content: 2,803 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Bihar, taking the total number of cases to 36,314: State Health Department

details.title: Per million testing in J&K reaches 44,744 as against 12,742 in the country
details.content: Per million testing in J&K reaches 44,744 as against 12,742 in the country; recovery rate touches 53.01%, lowest 0.8 positivity rate in Jammu, Reasi; Shopian's positivity rate highest at 8.3: Department of Information and Public Relations, Jammu & Kashmir

details.title: Maharashtra government cuts syllabus for Classes 1 to 12 by 25 per cent
details.content: The Maharashtra Government on Saturday announced that syllabus for Classes 1 to 12 will be reduced by 25 per cent so as to reduce the burden on students amid the coronavirus pandemic.

details.title: Untenable, says Gujarat government on AMA's plea for more COVID-19 tests
details.content: The state government has termed as "untenable and without any base" a demand by the Ahmedabad Medical Association (AMA)in the Gujarat High Court seeking increase in daily COVID-19 tests "in proportion to the population".

details.title: Students make technology innovations to battle COVID-19
details.content: From a mask-vending machine to a software that detects COVID-19, youngsters demonstrated an array of innovations on Saturday at an event to promote technological inventions vis--vis the pandemic. The 'Innovations Unlocked Kerala Student Innovators Meet' by the Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM) proved the quality of talent in countering the pandemic since the start of the nation-wide lockdown four months ago.

details.title: Streets empty, shops closed as Lucknow observes weekend lockdown
details.content: Lucknow streets wore a deserted look on Saturday as most shops and businesses were closed and public transport went off the roads in view of the state's second weekend lockdown of the month to combat COVID-19. The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to impose a strict lockdown across the state on weekends to stop the spread of the virus.

details.title: Increase daily COVID-19 testing to 1 lakh: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath to officials
details.content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday directed officials to enhance the state's COVID-19 testing capacity to one lakh tests per day by Monday. In a meeting with senior officials, the chief minister stressed on the need to increase the number of medical tests being done through RT-PCR and rapid antigen process in a phased manner for which 10 lakh testing kits should be acquired every 10 days, an official release issued here said.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh records 7,813 new cases in the last 24 hours
details.content:
#COVIDUpdates: AP records as many as 7,813 new cases in the last 24 hours taking the tally to 88,671. 52 deaths were recorded and the toll stands at 985. Nearly 50% patients recovered till date. @NewIndianXpress @Kalyan_TNIE #coronavirus #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/MqWZUT1eVC

— TNIE Andhra Pradesh (@xpressandhra) July 25, 2020

details.title: Fully geared up to deal with rise in COVID-19 cases: Punjab government
details.content: Amid rising number of COVID-19 cases, the Punjab government on Saturday said it is fully geared up to effectively deal with further spread of the disease with requisite bed capacity and ventilators in hospitals, and adequate arrangement of PPEs, masks, and testing kits.

details.title: Karnataka government​​​​​​​ waives crematorium fees for COVID-19 victims in Bengaluru
details.content: The Karnataka government on Saturday announced waiver of crematorium fees for those who succumb to the COVID-19 infection in Bengaluru and said the city civic body would bear the cost. It said that from now on, families of the COVID deceased need not pay any fees fixed by the city civic body- Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP)- across 12 electric crematoriums in the city. (READ MORE)

details.title: Uttar Pradesh reports record 2,971 fresh cases, 39 deaths
details.content: Uttar Pradesh on Saturday reported 39 more deaths due to COVID-19 and 2,971 fresh cases, the highest single-day spike in the state. The death toll due to the disease has mounted to 1,387, while the state's caseload has reached 63,742.

details.title: 1,142 fresh coronavirus cases, 29 deaths in Delhi
details.content: Delhi recorded 1,142 COVID-19 cases on Saturday, pushing the city's caseload to over 1.29 lakh, while the death toll jumped to 3,806, authorities said. Twenty-nine fatalities have been recorded in the last 24 hours, according to the health department.

details.title: Kerala Coronavirus Updates
details.content:
State sees the biggest single-day spike in fresh cases since the #COVID outbreak. On a positive note, over 1000 people recovered. @NewIndianXpress @MSKiranPrakash

Check out today's COVID numbers from Kerala: pic.twitter.com/FDD1RbOaWE

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) July 25, 2020

details.title: Tamil Nadu​​​​​​​ crosses two lakh COVID-19 cases mark with 6988 fresh infections
details.content: Tamil Nadu on Saturday breached the grim milestone of two lakh Coronavirus cases with the biggest daily spike of 6,988 fresh infections, pushing the tally to 2,06,737. The death toll climbed to 3,409 with 89 fatalities. The number of those discharged today after recovery was 7,758, taking the recoveries to 1,51,055, a health department bulletin said.

details.title: Odisha government issues guidelines for management of bodies
details.content:
#Odisha Govt issues guidelines for management of bodies.

Family members of patient died in #COVID19 are allowed to view the body at the time of removal from isolation room or area with precautions. Religious rituals that do not require touching of body allowed. @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/x4ScskpKnf

— Hemant Kumar Rout #StayHomeStaySafe (@TheHemantRout) July 25, 2020

details.content:

details.title: 523 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Jammu and Kashmir today
details.content: 523 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Jammu and Kashmir today; 156 from Jammu division and 367 from Kashmir division. The total number of cases stands at 17,305 including 7,483 actives cases, 9,517 recoveries and 305 deaths: Government of J&K

details.title: 10 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Dharavi area of Mumbai today
details.content: 10 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Dharavi area of Mumbai today, taking the total number of cases in Dharavi to 2,529 including 2,155 discharges and 124 active cases: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC)

details.title: Himachal reports 81 new cases
details.content: Himachal Pradesh reported 81 fresh COVID-19 cases on Saturday, pushing the state's tally to 2,036.

details.title: Bihar count crosses 36,000
details.content: With 2,803 new Covid-19 positive cases reported in Bihar, the state's tally of confirmed cases has crossed the 36,000-mark on Saturday. According to the latest update by the State Health Department, the total number of cases in the state has climbed to 36,314.

details.title: J&K's recovery rate increases to 53.10%
details.content: Meanwhile the positivity rate stood at 3 per cent as against the national average of 8.3 per cent, officials said on Saturday. The testing rate in the Union Territory has also improved to 44,744 sample examinations per million population as against the national average of 12,742, they said.

details.title: Record 1,081 new cases in Gujarat
details.content: The number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat rose to 54,712 with 1,081 new patients being detected on Saturday, highest in a single day, the state health department said. The death toll in the state rose to 2,305 with 22 more COVID-19 patients succumbing, it said.

details.title: 468 fresh cases take Punjab tally to 12,684
details.content: Nine people succumbed to COVID-19 in Punjab Saturday, pushing the death toll to 291, while 468 fresh cases took the tally to 12,684, authorities said. Four fatalities were reported in Ludhiana and one each in Jalandhar, Ferozepur, Amritsar, Barnala and Rupnagar, according to a medical bulletin.

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) July 25, 2020

details.title: Death toll mounts to 1,332 in Bengal
details.content: West Bengal reported a record 42 COVID-19 fatalities in a day, which pushed the death toll in the state to 1,332, the health department said on Saturday. The state registered 2,404 new coronavirus cases, the highest one-day spike, raising the tally to 56,377, it said in a bulletin.

— ANI (@ANI) July 25, 2020

details.content:
Requesting all Punjabis to stay vigilant CM Amarinder said that Punjab is at 18th position across India in coronavirus cases but COVID-19 will be a matter of concern till the time Punjab has even a single case left#Pb @Newindianxpress, @SundayStandard, @TheMornStandard

— Harpreet Singh Bajwa (@Harpreet_TNIE) July 25, 2020
